3.7.4	
Summary of evidence and recommendations for the management of congenital penile 
curvature
Examine varicocele in the standing position and classify into three grades.

Use scrotal ultrasound to evaluate testicular volume and to detect venous reflux in the 
supine and upright position and during Valsalva maneuver.

In all pre-pubertal boys with a varicocele and in all isolated right varicoceles, perform 
standard abdominal ultrasound to rule out a retroperitonal mass.

Inform caregivers and patients and offer surgery for varicocele associated with a persistent 
small testis (size difference of > 2 mL or 20%).

Use some form of optical magnification (microscopic or laparoscopic magnification) for 
surgical ligation.
Use lymphatic-sparing varicocelectomy to prevent hydrocele formation.
